result.execSummary:
The defendant Reggno J Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Restitution and Surcharges

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: Milwaukee County Case 92CF922120, if revoked.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Restitution is payable to Walmart joint and several with co-actors.  Restitution is to be paid as a Condition of Probation and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines.

Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
No contact with victims/businesses/co-actors listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Cases 14CF1262 and 15CF1135 were dismissed and read in.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Reggno J Robinson in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 3.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 3.

Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  3 Years.
Initial Confinement:  1.5 Years.
Extended Supervision: 1.5 Years.
Consecutive to Milwaukee County Case 92CF922120
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.


Term of Probation: 2 Years.
Consecutive to Milwaukee County Case 92CF922120
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  victims/businesses/co-actors listed in the complaint.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).


RESTITUTION:  $467 joint/serveral with co-actors (to be paid WalMart- restitution to be paid before costs or fines); 
If the Defense is contesting the restitution amount a request for a restitution hearing needs to be filed within 60 days of today's date.

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.


Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.


Defendant to be returned to Jackson Correctional - FORTHWITH.
